channel.title: Space.com
channel.description: Get the latest space exploration, innovation and astronomy news. Space.com celebrates humanity's ongoing expansion across the final frontier.

item.title: Boom! Scientists spot the biggest known explosion in the universe
item.description: A gargantuan explosion tore through the heart of a distant galaxy cluster, releasing about five times more energy than the previous record holder, a new study reports.
item.author: Mike Wall

item.title: SpaceX's next Starship prototype moves to launchpad for testing (video)
item.description: Look at that Starship go! A new time-lapse video shows a prototype of SpaceX's Mars-colonizing ship moving toward the launchpad for testing.
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: 'Star Wars: The High Republic' revealed: New books will introduce a bygone Jedi era
item.description: "Star Wars" is starting an epic "storytelling initiative" to fill out the history of the franchise some 200 years before the events of the 1999 movie "Star Wars: The Phantom Menace."
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: Two private satellites just docked in space in historic first for orbital servicing
item.description: In a historic first for satellite operations, one spacecraft "helper" docked with a working satellite to provide life-extension services.
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: Possible new 'minimoon' discovered orbiting Earth
item.description: Astronomers discovered a 'minimoon' that's been orbiting Earth for about three years, and may soon leave our planet's orbit.
item.author: Brandon Specktor

item.title: Space calendar 2020: Rocket launches, sky events, missions & more!
item.description: Here's a guide to all the rocket launches and astronomical events in 2020, as well as milestones for space missions, anniversaries and conferences.
item.author: Hanneke Weitering

item.title: Pictures from space! Our image of the day
item.description: The night sky above the Paranal Observatory in Chile is ablaze with vibrant airglow in this gorgeous view by astrophotographer Yuri Beletsky.
item.author: Space.com Staff

item.title: How to see Venus shining with the moon tonight
item.description: Tonight (Feb. 27), as darkness is falling, be sure to look toward the west-southwest sky to spot another beautiful celestial tableau formed by a lovely crescent moon and the brilliant planet Venus.
item.author: Joe Rao

item.title: On This Day in Space: Feb. 27, 1942: J.S. Hey discovers radio emissions from the sun
item.description: On Feb. 27, 1942, a British physicist named James Stanley Hey accidentally found out that the sun emits radio waves. See how it happened in our On This Day in Space video series!
item.author: Hanneke Weitering

item.title: Trump hails India's 'impressive strides' on moon exploration, pledges greater cooperation on space
item.description: India's rapid progress in lunar exploration has the attention of the president of the United States.
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: Baby Yoda toys from 'Star Wars' will launch an unstoppable campaign of cuteness this year
item.description: Fans of Disney's hit series "The Mandalorian" will be thrilled to see dozens of products inspired by "The Child" (better known as Baby Yoda) in stores this year.
item.author: Kasandra Brabaw

item.title: 'Superpuff' alien worlds could be ringed giant planets just like Saturn
item.description: All four outer planets in our solar system sport at least a few rings, but so far, we haven't observed any such features around exoplanets. That's confusing.
item.author: Paul Sutter

item.title: SpaceX delays next Dragon cargo ship launch for NASA due to rocket issue
item.description: SpaceX has delayed the launch of its next Dragon cargo ship bound for the International Space Station by at least four days in order to replace the upper stage of the mission's Falcon 9 rocket.
item.author: Tariq Malik

item.title: How to spot Canis Major, the big dog of winter
item.description: The constellation of Canis Major is visible in the winter sky this month.
item.author: Joe Rao

item.title: 15-million-year-old crater on Earth reveals clues about Mars' watery past
item.description: Meteorite samples from an ancient impact site in Germany may offer new clues about the history of oceans and life on Mars.
item.author: Samantha Mathewson

item.title: Chinese moon rover peers beneath surface of mysterious lunar far side
item.description: The first published data from the Yutu 2 rover's ground-penetrating radar instrument reveal the layered structure beneath the gray dirt of Von Kármán Crater's floor.
item.author: Mike Wall

item.title: NASA's VIPER moon mission to seek out lunar water slips to 2023
item.description: NASA is delaying the launch of a long-lived rover designed to sniff out water on the moon.
item.author: Meghan Bartels

item.title: Virgin Galactic gearing up to start selling suborbital spaceflight tickets again
item.description: If you're looking to book a ride to suborbital space with Virgin Galactic, you shouldn't have to wait much longer.
item.author: Mike Wall

item.title: Mars lander reveals new details about the Red Planet's strange magnetic field
item.description: The magnetic field in one zone on Mars is about 10 times stronger than scientists expected, and it's changing rapidly.
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: Can a rogue star kick Earth out of the solar system?
item.description: Life on any planet faces numerous existential threats — including the possibility of the planet getting kicked out of its solar system altogether. One team of researchers ran the numbers and found that the Earth is safe from such a catastrophe — almost.
item.author: Paul Sutter

item.title: This 'hot Jupiter' alien planet is dancing with death with its 18-hour year
item.description: A newly found planet orbits so close to its parent star that it's close to being torn apart by the tidal forces induced by gravity.
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: Isle of Man marks Apollo 13 50th with new 'One Giant Leap' stamps
item.description: A former NASA manager who was in mission control when Apollo 13 "had a problem" worked with a small postal service to celebrate the missions's 50th anniversary with new set of stamps.
item.author: Robert Z. Pearlman

item.title: 12 trippy objects hidden in the zodiac
item.description: The 12 constellations of the Zodiac contain some of the weirdest, most wonderful objects in the universe. Here are our favorites.
item.author: Brandon Specktor

item.title: Cosmic cookies! Astronaut weighs in on the future of baking in space
item.description: Recently, a batch of baked chocolate chip cookies returned from space, signifying a major step forward towards the future of how humans will eat and thrive in space.
item.author: Chelsea Gohd

item.title: Cut derelict spaceships into spare parts in 'Hardspace: Shipbreaker'
item.description: The developers of Homeworld: Deserts of Kharak have announced a new game, coming to Early Access this summer.
item.author: Christopher Livingston

item.title: Meet the 17-year-old who discovered an alien planet: A Q&A with high school student Wolf Cukier
item.description: 17-year-old high school student Wolf Cukier made a major discovery on the third day of his NASA internship, when he noticed the telltale signs of a distant planet orbiting two stars.
item.author: Doris Elin Urrutia

item.title: Hot Wheels is rolling out 2 remote-controlled Cybertrucks (cracked widow and all) in 2020
item.description: Tesla's futuristic Cybertruck is now a Hot Wheels toy. And it comes complete with a "cracked window sticker," so you can relive some of the vehicle's wildest moments.
item.author: Chelsea Gohd

item.title: What can the coronavirus outbreak teach us about bringing Mars samples back to Earth?
item.description: A new virus called SARS-CoV-2 is a coronavirus that has caused an outbreak of a disease called COVID-19. But what does that have to do with Mars?
item.author: Leonard David

item.title: Kerbal Space Program 2 trailer shows off nuclear propulsion, metallic hydrogen and torchships
item.description: Kerbal Space Program 2 may have been delayed, but that hasn't slowed down development or the dreams of a billion tiny green things.
item.author: Jonathan Bolding

item.title: NASA has a new idea to get the InSight lander's 'mole' on Mars digging again
item.description: The "mole" aboard NASA's Mars InSight lander is about to get yet another push.
item.author: Mike Wall
